What is the role of DMF in the structure of MOF 1?
data.answer: DMF acts as a monodentate ligand and is coordinated to the Sr2+ ions.

data.question: True or False: The MOF 1 framework collapses at temperatures above 500 °C.
What substrates were used for the growth of MOF 1 thin films?
data.answer: SrAl2O4, porous Al2O3, and Al foil.

data.question: How does the morphology of MOF 1 thin films depend on the substrate?
data.answer: The morphology of MOF 1 thin films depends on the surface chemistry and structure of the substrate.

data.question: True or False: The dielectric properties of MOF 1 thin films were significantly different when grown on SrAl2O4 substrate compared to porous Al2O3.
What is the main cause of ferroelectricity in MOF 1 according to the study?
data.answer: The motions of the coordinated DMF molecules under an applied ac electric field.

data.question: True or False: The DMF molecules in MOF 1 exhibit disorder at 403 K.
What method was used to synthesize the SrAl2O4 substrate?
True or False: The leakage current of MOF 1 is less than 10-7 A⋅cm-2 when the applied electric field is 2.0 kV⋅cm-1.
What analytical technique was used to measure the second-harmonic generation efficiency of MOF 1?
data.answer: A pulsed Q-switched Nd:YAG laser with λ = 1064 nm.

data.question: True or False: The dielectric constant of MOF 1 remains constant in the low-temperature regime below 270 K.
What is the role of Sr2+ ions in the structure of MOF 1?
data.answer: Sr2+ ions are coordinated by eight oxygen atoms from five BDC2– ligands and one DMF molecule, forming a distorted bicapped coordination octahedron.

data.question: True or False: The thermal stability of DMF molecules in MOF 1 is increased due to the coordination interaction with Sr2+ ions.
What is the significance of the noncentrosymmetric space group P31 in the properties of MOF 1?
data.answer: It allows MOF 1 to exhibit second-order nonlinear optical behavior and ferroelectric and dielectric properties.

data.question: True or False: The dielectric constant and dielectric loss of MOF 1 do not depend on the frequency of the ac electric field.
What is the effect of temperature on the Sr–O bond distances in MOF 1?
data.answer: The Sr–O bond distances increase slightly as the temperature rises from 293 to 403 K.

data.question: True or False: The DMF dipole moment was calculated using density functional theory at the b3lyp/6-31+g(d,p) level.
What is the estimated value of the characteristic ferroelectric parameters under an applied electric field of 1.98 kV cm–1 for MOF 1?
data.answer: Saturation spontaneous polarization ≈ 0.83 μC cm–2; remanent polarization ≈ 0.48 μC cm–2; and coercive field ≈ 0.81 kV cm–1.
